name: Most Popular
description: A curated list of the most recognized and widely-used AI tools across all domains.

tools.name: ChatGPT (OpenAI)
tools.description: The quintessential AI chatbot for drafting, ideation, and summarization.
tools.about: ChatGPT is a large language model-based chatbot developed by OpenAI. It is capable of understanding and generating human-like text, making it a versatile tool for a wide range of tasks, from writing emails to debugging code.
pros: Massive user base and community support.
cons: Knowledge cutoff (doesn't know about very recent events).
Can sometimes provide plausible but incorrect information.
Heavy usage may require a paid subscription.

tools.name: Gemini (Google)
tools.description: Google's powerful, multimodal AI model integrated across its ecosystem.
tools.about: Gemini is a family of multimodal large language models developed by Google AI. It is designed to understand and process text, images, audio, and video, making it a powerful engine for search, creativity, and productivity.
pros: Natively multimodal from the ground up.
Deep integration with Google's products (Search, Workspace).
Access to real-time information from the internet.
cons: Newer to the market than some competitors.
Feature availability can vary by region.
Some advanced features require a subscription.

tools.name: Grok (xAI)
tools.description: An AI chatbot by xAI with real-time access to the X (formerly Twitter) platform.
tools.about: Grok is a conversational AI developed by xAI, designed to have a bit of wit and a rebellious streak. Its unique feature is its real-time knowledge of the world via the X platform, allowing it to answer questions about very recent events.
pros: Real-time access to information from X.
Designed to have a more engaging and humorous personality.
Can handle spicy questions that other AIs might reject.
cons: Prone to sarcasm and may not be suitable for all professional tasks.
Still a very new model with ongoing development.

tools.name: Claude (Anthropic)
tools.description: A safety-focused AI assistant known for its large context window and thoughtful responses.
tools.about: Claude is an AI assistant built by Anthropic with a focus on being helpful, harmless, and honest. It excels at tasks requiring a large amount of context, such as summarizing long documents or analyzing entire codebases.
pros: Extremely large context window for processing long texts.
Strong emphasis on AI safety and ethics.
Often provides more nuanced and cautious responses.
cons: Free version can have usage limits that reset daily.
May be less inclined to answer controversial or borderline prompts.
API access is more limited than some competitors.

tools.name: Llama (Meta)
tools.description: Meta's family of powerful, open-source large language models for research and commercial use.
tools.about: Llama is a family of large language models released by Meta. A key distinction is its open-source nature, which allows developers and researchers to run, modify, and build upon the models freely, fostering a collaborative and transparent AI ecosystem.
pros: Open source and free for research and commercial use.
Can be fine-tuned and run locally for privacy and customization.
cons: Requires significant technical expertise and hardware to run.
Base models lack the safety guardrails of commercial products.
The ecosystem of tools is less mature than for proprietary models.

tools.name: DeepSeek
tools.description: An open-source language and code model known for its strong coding capabilities.
tools.about: DeepSeek is a family of AI models with a particular focus on code generation and understanding. The open-source DeepSeek Coder models are highly regarded in the developer community for their performance on programming benchmarks.
pros: Provides a powerful alternative to proprietary coding assistants.
cons: Less focused on general conversational ability.
Requires technical knowledge to implement and use effectively.
Smaller community compared to more general-purpose models.

tools.name: Perplexity AI
tools.description: A conversational search engine that provides direct answers with cited sources.
tools.about: Perplexity AI functions as a conversational 'answer engine,' distinguishing itself from traditional search engines by providing direct, summarized answers to user queries, complete with in-line citations of its sources.
pros: Provides citations for all its claims.
cons: Less suited for creative or open-ended tasks.
Can be slower than a traditional search engine.
Pro version required for advanced features like file uploads.

tools.name: GitHub Copilot
tools.description: An AI pair programmer that offers autocomplete-style suggestions as you code.
tools.about: GitHub Copilot is a cloud-based artificial intelligence tool developed by GitHub and OpenAI to assist users of various code editors by autocompleting code. It understands context from comments and code to suggest individual lines and whole functions instantly.
pros: Dramatically speeds up coding and reduces boilerplate.
Integrates seamlessly into popular code editors.
cons: Requires a subscription after the trial period.
Suggestions can sometimes be non-optimal or contain subtle bugs.
Raises questions about code originality and licensing.

tools.name: Microsoft Copilot
tools.description: A cross‑product AI assistant integrated into Bing, Edge, Windows, and Microsoft 365.
tools.about: Microsoft Copilot brings generative AI to everyday workflows across web, desktop, and productivity apps, offering chat, image generation, and contextual help.
cons: May require paid M365 plans for full power.

tools.name: Mistral Le Chat
tools.description: Fast, concise chat built on Mistral’s open and efficient models.
tools.about: Mistral’s chat app provides snappy responses and strong coding/writing with lean models that run efficiently.

tools.name: Meta AI
tools.description: Consumer assistant integrated into Meta apps with image and search features.
tools.about: Meta AI offers chat, image generation, and search‑enhanced answers across Meta properties, focusing on mainstream, mobile‑first usage.

tools.name: dify
tools.description: Production-ready platform for agentic workflow development.
tools.about: Production-ready platform for agentic workflow development.

tools.name: supabase
tools.description: The Postgres development platform. Supabase gives you a dedicated Postgres database to build your web, mobile, and AI applications.
tools.about: The Postgres development platform. Supabase gives you a dedicated Postgres database to build your web, mobile, and AI applications.

tools.name: NextChat
tools.description: ✨ Light and Fast AI Assistant. Support: Web | iOS | MacOS | Android |  Linux | Windows
tools.about: ✨ Light and Fast AI Assistant. Support: Web | iOS | MacOS | Android |  Linux | Windows

tools.name: lobe-chat
tools.description: 🤯 Lobe Chat - an open-source, modern design AI chat framework. Supports multiple AI providers (OpenAI / Claude 4 / Gemini / DeepSeek / Ollama / Qwen), Knowledge Base (file upload / RAG ), one click install MCP Marketplace and Artifacts / Thinking. One-click FREE deployment of your private AI Agent application.
tools.about: 🤯 Lobe Chat - an open-source, modern design AI chat framework. Supports multiple AI providers (OpenAI / Claude 4 / Gemini / DeepSeek / Ollama / Qwen), Knowledge Base (file upload / RAG ), one click install MCP Marketplace and Artifacts / Thinking. One-click FREE deployment of your private AI Agent application.

tools.name: PaddleOCR
tools.description: Turn any PDF or image document into structured data for your AI. A powerful, lightweight OCR toolkit that bridges the gap between images/PDFs and LLMs. Supports 80+ languages.
tools.about: Turn any PDF or image document into structured data for your AI. A powerful, lightweight OCR toolkit that bridges the gap between images/PDFs and LLMs. Supports 80+ languages.

tools.about: CLI platform to experiment with codegen. Precursor to: https://lovable.dev

tools.about: LlamaIndex is the leading framework for building LLM-powered agents over your data.

tools.about: High-performance runtime for multi-agent systems. Build, run and manage secure multi-agent systems in your cloud.

tools.about: QuillBot helps rewrite, summarize, and improve clarity of text for students, writers, and professionals.

tools.about: You.com combines search, chat, and generative AI for a customizable, privacy-respecting experience.

tools.about: Bard is Google's conversational AI, designed for creative writing, Q&A, and productivity.

tools.about: Replika is an AI chatbot designed for personal conversation, support, and companionship.

tools.name: Poe by Quora
tools.description: An app that provides access to a variety of different AI chatbots in one place.
tools.about: Poe is a platform that allows users to interact with a range of different AI models, including those from OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google. It also allows users to create their own custom bots with specific instructions.
pros: Access to multiple leading AI models in one interface.
Ability to create and share custom bots.
Fast and responsive mobile and web apps.
cons: Free access to the best models is limited.
Requires a subscription for heavy usage.
The quality of user-created bots can vary wildly.

tools.name: DeepL
tools.description: A highly accurate AI-powered translation service known for its natural-sounding output.
tools.about: DeepL is a deep learning-based translation service that is widely considered to be one of the most accurate in the world. It excels at capturing nuance and producing translations that sound natural and fluent.
pros: Preserves the nuance and tone of the source text.
Offers a powerful API for developers.
cons: Free version has limits on text length and usage.
Fewer languages supported than some competitors like Google Translate.
Pro features like document translation require a subscription.

tools.name: Grammarly
tools.description: An AI-powered writing assistant that checks grammar, spelling, style, and tone.
tools.about: Grammarly is a cloud-based typing assistant that reviews spelling, grammar, punctuation, clarity, engagement, and delivery mistakes. It uses AI to go beyond basic checks, offering suggestions on tone, word choice, and sentence structure.
pros: Excellent for catching grammatical errors and typos.
Provides suggestions for improving writing style and clarity.
Integrates with browsers, email clients, and word processors.
cons: The best features are locked behind a premium subscription.
Can sometimes make suggestions that alter the intended meaning.
Generative AI features are newer and less developed than dedicated chatbots.

tools.name: Character.AI
tools.description: Persona‑driven conversational agents for creative and social chats.
tools.about: Create and chat with custom personalities for entertainment, brainstorming, and roleplay.

tools.name: Mistral Le Chat

tools.about: Concise, code‑friendly responses with efficient open models.

tools.name: Microsoft Copilot
tools.description: Web chat assistant with Bing context and plugins.
tools.about: Brings web‑aware chat, image creation, and graph‑based answers in one place.

tools.about: AutoGPT is the vision of accessible AI for everyone, to use and to build on. Our mission is to provide the tools, so that you can focus on what matters.

name: Image Generation
description: Create unique, high-quality images from text descriptions.
icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="h-10 w-10" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 3a2 2 0 00-2 2v10a2 2 0 002 2h12a2 2 0 002-2V5a2 2 0 00-2-2H4zm12 12H4l4-8 3 6 2-4 3 6z" clip-rule="evenodd" /></svg>

tools.name: DreamStudio
tools.description: Official web app for Stable Diffusion image generation.
tools.about: DreamStudio is the official web interface for Stable Diffusion, offering easy prompt-based image creation.

tools.name: Canva AI
tools.description: Design platform with generative AI features for images and layouts.
tools.about: Canva AI offers text-to-image, Magic Design, and other generative features for easy content creation.

tools.name: Clipdrop
tools.description: AI-powered image enhancement and background removal.
tools.about: Clipdrop provides tools for background removal, relighting, upscaling, and more using AI.

tools.name: Fotor AI
tools.description: Photo editing and enhancement with AI features.
tools.about: Fotor AI offers one-click photo enhancement, background removal, and creative effects.

tools.name: Midjourney
tools.description: A premier text-to-image AI that creates stunning, artistic visuals from prompts.
tools.about: Midjourney is an independent research lab that produces an artificial intelligence program that creates images from textual descriptions. It is known for its highly artistic and coherent image outputs, making it a favorite among artists and designers.
pros: Very active community and rapid development.
Powerful control over image styles and composition.
cons: Requires using Discord to interact with the bot.
Can be complex for beginners to master advanced prompting.

tools.name: Stable Diffusion
tools.description: A powerful, open-source image generation model that can be run locally.
tools.about: Stable Diffusion is a deep learning, text-to-image model released by Stability AI. Its main distinction is that it is open source and can be run on consumer-grade hardware, allowing for immense flexibility, privacy, and customization.
pros: Can be run locally for privacy and no usage costs.
Huge community and ecosystem of custom models (checkpoints).
cons: Requires technical knowledge to set up and run locally.
Quality can be inconsistent without fine-tuning and specific models.
Web-based versions (like DreamStudio) have usage credits.

tools.name: DALL-E 3 (OpenAI)
tools.description: OpenAI's advanced image generation model, integrated into ChatGPT Plus.
tools.about: DALL-E 3 is the latest version of OpenAI's text-to-image model. It is known for its ability to follow complex prompts with a high degree of accuracy and nuance, and it's directly integrated into the ChatGPT interface for paid users.
pros: Excellent at interpreting complex, detailed prompts.
Natively integrated with ChatGPT for easy use.
Generally better at rendering text and hands than previous models.
cons: Less artistic control compared to Midjourney's parameters.

tools.name: Leonardo Ai
tools.description: A platform for generating game assets, concept art, and other artistic images.
tools.about: Leonardo Ai is a generative AI platform focused on creative assets. It offers a suite of tools, including image generation, AI canvas for editing, and the ability to train your own custom models on your art style.
pros: Generous free tier with daily credits.
Strong focus on gaming and creative asset generation.
cons: Interface can be complex for new users.
Image quality can be less consistent than Midjourney.
Popularity can lead to slow generation times.

tools.name: Adobe Firefly
tools.description: Adobe's family of creative generative AI models, integrated into Photoshop and other apps.
tools.about: Adobe Firefly is a generative AI model designed to be commercially safe. It's trained exclusively on Adobe Stock's licensed content and public domain images, and is deeply integrated into Adobe's Creative Cloud apps like Photoshop and Illustrator.
pros: Designed to be safe for commercial use.
Seamless integration with Adobe's professional creative tools.
Powerful features like Generative Fill in Photoshop.
cons: Requires an Adobe Creative Cloud subscription for full integration.
Less suited for highly artistic or abstract styles.
Generative credits are required for heavy usage.

tools.name: Ideogram
tools.description: An AI image generator that excels at rendering text and typography within images.
tools.about: Ideogram launched with a primary focus on solving one of the biggest challenges for AI image generators: reliably rendering text. It allows users to create images that include specific words or phrases, making it great for logos, posters, and memes.
pros: Best-in-class for generating images with accurate text.
Offers a free tier for generation.
cons: Overall image quality can be slightly lower than top competitors.
Fewer advanced features and parameters to control.
Can be slow during peak usage times.

tools.name: Magnific AI
tools.description: An AI-powered image upscaler and enhancer that adds incredible detail.
tools.about: Magnific AI is not a generator but an upscaler. It uses AI to increase the resolution of images while adding new, coherent details, transforming low-resolution pictures into stunning, high-definition artworks.
pros: Creates incredible levels of detail in upscaled images.
Can 'hallucinate' details in a creative and convincing way.
Powerful controls for creativity and adherence to the original.
cons: Can be slow to process images.
The creative upscaling may not be suitable for all use cases (e.g., photo restoration).

tools.name: Playground v2 (Playground AI)
tools.description: Accessible image generation with strong typography and styles.
tools.about: Fast, creative generations with good text rendering and an easy prompt UI.

tools.name: ComfyUI
tools.description: Node‑based Stable Diffusion workflow UI for power users.
tools.about: A modular graph editor for complex SD pipelines, fine control, and reproducible workflows.

tools.name: NightCafe
tools.description: Beginner‑friendly image generator with presets and social challenges.
tools.about: Create art quickly using style presets; join community challenges to explore prompts.

tools.description: Stable Diffusion web UI
tools.about: Stable Diffusion web UI

tools.about: A latent text-to-image diffusion model

tools.about: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models

name: Video Tools
description: Generate and edit video content using AI-powered features.

tools.name: DeepBrain AI
tools.description: AI avatars for video presentations and explainers.
tools.about: DeepBrain AI generates realistic AI avatars for video content, news, and training.

tools.name: D-ID
tools.description: Create talking head videos from photos using AI.
tools.about: D-ID animates photos into talking head videos for presentations, learning, and more.

tools.name: Veed.io
tools.description: Online video editor with AI-powered features.
tools.about: Veed.io offers video editing, subtitles, and AI tools for content creators.

tools.name: Pictory
tools.description: AI video creation from text and blog posts.
tools.about: Pictory turns scripts and blog posts into short videos with AI narration and visuals.

tools.name: Sora (OpenAI)
tools.description: A state-of-the-art text-to-video model for creating realistic and imaginative scenes.
tools.about: Sora is a text-to-video model developed by OpenAI, capable of generating high-fidelity, minute-long videos from textual prompts. It demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of language, physics, and cinematic composition, allowing it to create complex scenes with multiple characters, specific types of motion, and accurate details of the subject and background.
pros: Creates exceptionally realistic and imaginative video scenes.
Capable of generating longer, more coherent video clips than many competitors.
Understands complex prompts and object permanence.
cons: Access is currently limited to a select group of testers and creatives.
May still struggle with the physics of complex scenes and cause-and-effect.
Carries significant potential for misuse in creating misinformation.

tools.name: Kling (Kuaishou)
tools.description: A powerful text-to-video model capable of producing long, high-definition clips.
tools.about: Kling is a text-to-video model developed by Kuaishou, a Chinese tech company. It is capable of generating up to two minutes of high-definition (1080p) video at 30 frames per second. The model has shown a remarkable ability to create physically realistic motion and large-scale, dynamic scenes, positioning it as a strong competitor to other leading video generation models.
pros: Excellent at simulating complex and realistic motion.
Utilizes a 3D VAE for more expressive and consistent character generation.
cons: Can have long rendering times, especially for free users.
As with other models, can sometimes misinterpret prompts or render details like hands or text inaccurately.
Waitlist for access can be long.

tools.name: Runway
tools.description: An all-in-one suite for AI-powered video creation and editing.
tools.about: Runway is a comprehensive platform offering a wide array of AI magic tools for video, including text-to-video generation, video-to-video style transfer, automatic background removal (rotoscoping), and much more.
pros: Massive suite of powerful AI video tools.
Web-based and relatively easy to use.
Offers a free tier to experiment with features.
cons: Video generation can be slow and is credit-intensive.
Free tier has significant limitations (e.g., watermarks, lower resolution).
Can be expensive for heavy users.

tools.name: Pika
tools.description: A user-friendly platform for generating short, high-quality video clips from text.
tools.about: Pika specializes in text-to-video and image-to-video generation, aiming to make video creation accessible to everyone. It's known for its ease of use and the cinematic quality of its output.
pros: Free to try with a daily credit allowance.
cons: Limited to very short video clips (a few seconds).
Less control over video details compared to professional software.
High demand can lead to long generation queues.

tools.name: Synthesia
tools.description: Create professional videos with AI avatars and voiceovers in minutes.
tools.about: Synthesia is a leading platform for creating AI-generated videos, primarily for corporate training and communication. Users can choose from a library of stock avatars or create their own, and then generate a video from a script in multiple languages.
pros: Creates professional-looking videos without cameras or microphones.
Wide selection of realistic AI avatars and voices.
Excellent for creating training and instructional content at scale.
cons: Can be expensive, with plans aimed at businesses.
The 'uncanny valley' effect can be noticeable with some avatars.
Less suited for creative or narrative video content.

tools.name: Descript
tools.description: An all-in-one audio and video editor that works like a document.
tools.about: Descript revolutionizes video editing by first transcribing the content, then allowing users to edit the video by simply editing the text transcript. It also includes AI features like filler word removal, voice cloning, and automatic studio sound.
pros: Intuitive text-based video editing is a game-changer.
Powerful AI features for cleaning up audio.
Includes screen recording and transcription services.
cons: Can be resource-intensive on some computers.
The free tier is quite limited.
Subscription is necessary for any serious work.

tools.name: InVideo
tools.description: An online video editor with AI-powered features for quick video creation.
tools.about: InVideo is a web-based video creation platform that uses AI to help users turn text content, such as blog posts, into videos. It offers a large library of templates, stock footage, and music, making it ideal for social media and marketing content.
pros: AI text-to-video feature is great for content repurposing.
Massive library of templates and stock assets.
cons: AI-generated videos can feel generic and require customization.
Exporting in high resolution is a premium feature.
The editor can sometimes be slow and buggy.

tools.name: HeyGen
tools.description: A platform for creating AI spokesperson videos and translating video content.
tools.about: HeyGen is an AI video platform that specializes in generating spokesperson videos with realistic avatars. Its standout feature is AI-powered video translation, which can change the spoken language of a person in a video while syncing their lip movements.
pros: Impressive video translation and lip-sync feature.
Good selection of high-quality AI avatars.
Free trial allows for the creation of a short video.
cons: Avatar customization is limited on lower-tier plans.
Processing times for videos can be long.

tools.name: Luma Dream Machine
tools.description: High‑quality text‑to‑video and video‑to‑video generation.
tools.about: Generates cinematic clips with good motion and style adherence from short prompts.

tools.name: Google Veo
tools.description: Cinematic text‑to‑video model previewed by Google DeepMind.
tools.about: Advanced T2V with strong scene coherence and camera control showcased in research demos.

tools.name: Kaiber
tools.description: Creative video transformations and stylized animations from images or text.
tools.about: Turn static images into animated clips and apply stylistic transformations easily.

tools.name: youtube-dl
tools.description: Command-line program to download videos from YouTube.com and other video sites
tools.about: Command-line program to download videos from YouTube.com and other video sites

name: Code Assistance
description: AI-powered tools that help you write, debug, and optimize code faster.

tools.name: Blackbox AI
tools.description: AI code search and autocomplete for developers.
tools.about: Blackbox AI provides code search, autocomplete, and code generation for multiple languages.

tools.name: GitHub Copilot
tools.description: An AI pair programmer that offers autocomplete-style suggestions as you code.
tools.about: GitHub Copilot is a cloud-based artificial intelligence tool developed by GitHub and OpenAI to assist users of various code editors by autocompleting code. It understands context from comments and code to suggest individual lines and whole functions instantly.
pros: Dramatically speeds up coding and reduces boilerplate.
Integrates seamlessly into popular code editors.
cons: Requires a subscription after the trial period.
Suggestions can sometimes be non-optimal or contain subtle bugs.
Raises questions about code originality and licensing.

tools.name: Cursor
tools.description: An AI-first code editor designed for pair-programming with a powerful AI.
tools.about: Cursor is a standalone code editor built from the ground up for AI-assisted development. It's a fork of VS Code that deeply integrates features like code generation, debugging with AI, and project-wide understanding of your codebase.
pros: Deeply integrated AI features feel native.
Can understand and work with your entire codebase.
cons: Is a separate application, not a plugin for your existing editor.
Still a newer product, so some features may be less polished than established editors.

tools.name: Tabnine
tools.description: An AI code completion assistant that can be run locally for privacy.
tools.about: Tabnine is one of the original AI code assistants. It provides powerful code completions and, for enterprise teams, can be trained on specific codebases and run entirely locally, ensuring code privacy and security.
pros: Can be run locally for maximum privacy.
Can be personalized by training on your own repositories.
Supports a wide range of languages and editors.
cons: The free version is less powerful than competitors.
Local models require significant computational resources.
User interface for configuration can be complex.

tools.name: Replit Ghostwriter
tools.description: An AI coding assistant built into the Replit online IDE.
tools.about: Ghostwriter is Replit's native AI assistant. It provides features like code completion, code explanation, and bug fixing directly within the browser-based Replit development environment, making it a seamless experience for users of the platform.
pros: Perfectly integrated into the Replit ecosystem.
Includes features for explaining and transforming code.
cons: Requires a Replit subscription to use.
Tied to the Replit online IDE.
May be less powerful than standalone tools like Copilot.

tools.name: Amazon CodeWhisperer
tools.description: Amazon's AI coding companion, with a generous free tier for individuals.
tools.about: CodeWhisperer is Amazon's answer to GitHub Copilot. It provides real-time code suggestions and is particularly well-integrated with AWS services. It also includes a reference tracker to help identify if a suggestion resembles open-source training data.
pros: Strong integration with AWS services and APIs.
Includes a reference tracker for code attribution.
cons: Can be less accurate than Copilot for non-AWS code.
The professional tier for businesses can be expensive.
User interface is less polished in some editors.

tools.name: Phind
tools.description: An AI search engine and pair programmer for developers.
tools.about: Phind is an AI-powered search engine designed specifically for developers. Instead of just links, it provides direct answers, code examples, and summaries based on information from across the web, acting like an expert that is always up-to-date.
pros: Excellent for getting quick, synthesized answers to technical questions.
Provides code examples and links to sources.
cons: Not an IDE plugin, so it requires switching context.
Can sometimes hallucinate answers or combine information incorrectly.
The paid tier is required for the most advanced models.

tools.name: Codeium
tools.description: Free AI code completion and chat for individuals across many IDEs.
tools.about: Fast, privacy‑friendly completions and inline chat with broad language support.
cons: Less deep repo context than Cody.

tools.name: Sourcegraph Cody
tools.description: Codebase‑aware AI for large repos with powerful context windows.
tools.about: Understands big monorepos, references, and symbols to answer and refactor at scale.

tools.name: JetBrains AI Assistant
tools.description: Native AI coding features across JetBrains IDEs.
tools.about: Inline chat, code generation, and refactors within JetBrains products.

tools.description: Copilot regurgitating Quake code, including sweary comments
tools.about: Copilot regurgitating Quake code, including sweary comments

tools.description: Kite – Programming Copilot
tools.about: Kite – Programming Copilot

tools.description: Show HN: Sketch – AI code-writing assistant that understands data content
tools.about: Show HN: Sketch – AI code-writing assistant that understands data content

name: Audio & Music
description: Generate music, voiceovers, and sound effects with AI.

tools.name: Voicemod AI
tools.description: AI-powered real-time voice changer and effects.
tools.about: Voicemod AI lets you transform your voice in real time for gaming, streaming, and content creation.

tools.name: Descript Overdub
tools.description: AI voice cloning and editing for podcasts and video.
tools.about: Descript Overdub allows you to create a digital voice clone for editing and generating audio content.

tools.name: Cleanvoice AI
tools.description: AI-powered audio cleanup for podcasts and recordings.
tools.about: Cleanvoice AI removes filler words, stutters, and background noise from audio files.

tools.name: Suno AI
tools.description: Create full songs (lyrics, instruments, and vocals) from a simple text prompt.
tools.about: Suno is a remarkable AI music generator that can create complete, two-minute songs in various genres based on a short text description. It generates lyrics, instrumental tracks, and AI-generated vocals, which can then be extended into longer pieces.
pros: Incredibly easy to create full songs from a prompt.
Supports a wide variety of musical genres.
Free tier allows for daily song creation.
cons: Limited control over specific musical elements (e.g., chord progressions).
Commercial use of generated music requires a paid plan.

tools.name: Udio
tools.description: A new and powerful AI music generation tool for creating full tracks with vocals.
tools.about: Udio is a recent entrant in the AI music generation space that has quickly gained popularity for its high-quality output. Similar to Suno, it can generate complete songs with lyrics and vocals from text prompts, often with surprisingly coherent and catchy results.
pros: Generates very high-quality and coherent music.
Generous free tier with a large number of monthly credits.
cons: As a new service, long-term availability is unknown.
Can have long queues during peak demand.
Limited fine-tuning controls for advanced users.

tools.name: Stable Audio (Stability AI)
tools.description: An AI music and sound effect generator with audio-to-audio capabilities.
tools.about: Stable Audio is Stability AI's platform for music and sound effect generation. The latest version can produce high-quality, full tracks up to three minutes long with coherent musical structures. A key feature is its audio-to-audio capability, allowing users to upload an audio sample and transform it using a text prompt, offering a powerful tool for remixing and sound design.
pros: Generates full, three-minute songs in high-quality stereo.
Innovative audio-to-audio feature for transforming existing sounds.
Offers a free tier for experimentation.
cons: The quality of the output can depend heavily on the quality of an uploaded audio sample.
The range of features may be complex for absolute beginners.
Commercial use and advanced features require a paid subscription.

tools.name: ElevenLabs
tools.description: Best-in-class AI for generating realistic text-to-speech and voice clones.
tools.about: ElevenLabs is a voice technology research company, widely regarded as the market leader in text-to-speech (TTS) and voice cloning. Its models can produce incredibly lifelike and emotive speech in a multitude of languages and accents.
pros: Ability to clone your own voice from a short sample.
Generous free tier for getting started.
cons: Can be expensive for high-volume usage.
Voice cloning technology raises ethical concerns about misuse.
Fine-tuning emotional delivery requires specific syntax.

tools.name: AIVA
tools.description: An AI music composer that creates emotional soundtracks for films, games, and commercials.
tools.about: AIVA (Artificial Intelligence Virtual Artist) is an AI that specializes in composing emotional, orchestral music. It's designed for creative professionals who need original soundtracks for their projects, and it allows for a high degree of customization.
pros: Excellent for creating classical and cinematic music.
Allows users to edit the generated MIDI tracks.
Copyright of the music can be owned with a pro plan.
cons: Less suited for modern genres like pop or electronic music.
The free version has significant restrictions on usage and monetization.
The interface can be complex for beginners.

tools.name: Adobe Podcast
tools.description: A web-based tool with AI-powered features for cleaning up and improving voice recordings.
tools.about: Adobe Podcast offers a suite of free AI tools for podcasters and content creators. Its most famous feature is 'Enhance Speech,' which can make amateur voice recordings sound as if they were recorded in a professional studio by removing noise and echo.
pros: 'Enhance Speech' feature is incredibly effective and free.
Simple, web-based interface is very easy to use.
Also includes a tool for checking microphone quality.
cons: Limited to audio enhancement, not a full editor.
File size and duration limits apply to the free tools.
Part of Adobe's ecosystem, which may encourage paid subscriptions.

tools.name: LALAL.AI
tools.description: An AI-powered service for splitting audio tracks into their constituent stems.
tools.about: LALAL.AI is a stem separation service that uses AI to extract vocals, accompaniment, and individual instruments from any audio or video file. It's a powerful tool for music producers, DJs, and musicians who want to create remixes or practice with backing tracks.
pros: Supports a wide range of file formats.
cons: The free version has very limited processing time.
Credit-based system can be costly for bulk processing.
The quality of separation can depend on the complexity of the source audio.

tools.name: Play.ht
tools.description: Realistic TTS and custom voice cloning for content and apps.
tools.about: Large voice library, SSML controls, and cloning for podcasts, videos, and products.

tools.name: Auphonic
tools.description: AI audio leveling, noise reduction, and mastering.
tools.about: Post‑production for podcasts and videos with target loudness and cleanup.

tools.name: Kits AI
tools.description: Voice models, cloning, and conversions for music creators.
tools.about: Convert vocals between timbres, build custom voices, and explore curated model library.

tools.name: Real-Time-Voice-Cloning
tools.description: Clone a voice in 5 seconds to generate arbitrary speech in real-time
tools.about: Clone a voice in 5 seconds to generate arbitrary speech in real-time

tools.about: Show HN: Voice-Pro – AI Voice Cloning

tools.about: DeepL is a deep learning-based translation service known for its natural-sounding output.

tools.name: Suno AI
tools.description: Create full songs from a simple text prompt.
tools.about: Suno is an AI music generator that creates complete songs in various genres from a short text description.

tools.name: Notion AI
tools.description: An AI assistant integrated directly into the Notion productivity workspace.
tools.about: Notion AI is a suite of features built into the Notion platform. It can summarize existing notes, draft content, brainstorm ideas, translate text, and organize data, all within your existing Notion pages.
pros: Seamlessly integrated into the Notion workflow.
Can work with your existing documents and databases.
Versatile for a wide range of productivity tasks.
cons: Requires a Notion account and is a paid add-on.
Less powerful than standalone, dedicated AI models.
Effectiveness depends on how well-structured your Notion workspace is.

tools.name: Fireflies.ai
tools.description: An AI meeting assistant that transcribes, summarizes, and analyzes voice conversations.
tools.about: Fireflies.ai joins your online meetings as a participant to record, transcribe, and summarize the conversation. It identifies action items, key topics, and allows you to search the transcript later.
pros: Automates the process of taking meeting notes.
Integrates with most popular calendar and conferencing tools.
cons: Transcription accuracy can vary with audio quality and accents.
Free tier has limits on storage and features.
Some users may have privacy concerns about a bot joining their calls.

tools.name: SaneBox
tools.description: An AI-powered tool for cleaning up and organizing your email inbox.
tools.about: SaneBox uses AI to analyze your email history and automatically filter unimportant messages out of your inbox into a separate folder. It helps you focus on what's important without changing your email client or habits.
pros: Learns from your behavior to improve its filtering.
Includes other useful features like email reminders and do-not-disturb.
cons: Requires a paid subscription after a trial period.
Requires giving a third-party service access to your email.
Can occasionally mis-categorize an important email.

tools.name: Motion
tools.description: An AI-powered calendar and project manager that automatically schedules your tasks.
tools.about: Motion is a tool that aims to replace your calendar, to-do list, and project manager. Its core feature is an AI that automatically schedules your tasks into your calendar, reorganizing your day dynamically as new priorities arise.
pros: Intelligently schedules tasks to optimize your day.
Combines calendar, tasks, and project management in one app.
Helps ensure you have time for all your priorities.
cons: Requires a significant commitment to get the most out of it.
The auto-scheduling approach may not suit everyone's working style.

tools.name: Reclaim.ai
tools.description: An AI scheduling assistant that finds the best time for your tasks, habits, and meetings.
tools.about: Reclaim.ai connects to your Google Calendar and intelligently blocks time for your tasks, routines, and habits. It's designed to be flexible, automatically rescheduling items as your day changes, ensuring your priorities are protected.
pros: Excellent for time-blocking and protecting focus time.
Flexible scheduling automatically adapts to changes.
Free plan is very capable for individuals.
cons: Can take some time to set up and configure properly.
The user interface can feel a bit dated.

tools.name: Todoist
tools.description: A leading to-do list app with new AI-powered features for task management.
tools.about: Todoist is a popular task management application. It has recently integrated AI features that can help users break down large tasks into smaller, manageable steps, suggest next actions for a project, and help rephrase tasks to be more actionable.
pros: Clean, fast, and reliable task management.
AI features help with planning and overcoming procrastination.
cons: Most AI features require a paid plan.
The AI is an assistant, not a full-fledged project manager.
Can be simpler than what's needed for complex team projects.

tools.name: Otter.ai
tools.description: Live meeting transcription with summaries and action items.
tools.about: Real‑time capture and searchable transcripts for Zoom, Meet, and Teams.

tools.about: Drafts, analyzes, and visualizes directly inside M365 apps using your tenant data.

tools.description: Generative AI inside Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Gmail.
tools.about: Write, analyze, and visualize with AI in Google Workspace apps.

description: AI-powered assistants for UI/UX design, presentations, and graphic creation.
icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="h-10 w-10" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor"><path d="M17.414 2.586a2 2 0 00-2.828 0L7 10.172V13h2.828l7.586-7.586a2 2 0 000-2.828z" /><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M2 6a2 2 0 012-2h4a1 1 0 010 2H4v10h10v-4a1 1 0 112 0v4a2 2 0 01-2 2H4a2 2 0 01-2-2V6z" clip-rule="evenodd" /></svg>

tools.name: Tome
tools.description: An AI-powered tool for generating entire presentations and narrative documents.
tools.about: Tome is an AI-powered storytelling and presentation tool that goes beyond simple slides. It generates entire presentations from a single prompt, complete with AI-generated text and images. It focuses on creating a narrative flow and allows for the embedding of interactive content like 3D renderings, web pages, and data visualizations, making for a more dynamic experience than traditional slideshows.
pros: Incredibly fast for generating an entire, structured presentation from one prompt.
Creates visually appealing and modern designs automatically.
cons: Layouts and design options can be less flexible than manual tools like Figma or PowerPoint.
The free plan is limited, and core AI features require a subscription.
The highly visual style may not be suitable for all corporate or formal settings.

tools.name: Gamma
tools.description: An AI alternative to slide decks for creating engaging presentations and docs.
tools.about: Gamma is an AI tool designed to create engaging presentations, documents, and webpages with minimal effort. Instead of forcing users to build slide by slide, Gamma allows them to draft an entire presentation from a prompt and then refine it using a flexible, card-based editor. It emphasizes speed and ease of use, with one-click restyling and polishing features.
pros: Extremely user-friendly and fast for generating content.
Outputs are web-native and responsive on any device.
Offers a generous free plan with a recurring credit system.
cons: Limited variety in design themes compared to more established tools.
Export options can be limited, with potential formatting issues when converting to PowerPoint or Google Slides.

tools.name: Figma AI (Diagram)
tools.description: AI plugins and widgets within Figma to automate design tasks.
tools.about: While Figma itself is a design tool, its ecosystem is rich with AI plugins. Diagram, for instance, can automatically generate flowcharts and diagrams from text. Other plugins assist with generating UI copy, color palettes, and design assets.
pros: Integrates directly into the industry-standard design tool.
Massive time-saver for repetitive design tasks.
Many plugins are free to use.
cons: Functionality is dependent on third-party plugin developers.
Can be a collection of single-task tools rather than one cohesive AI.
Quality and reliability of plugins can vary.

tools.name: Galileo AI
tools.description: Generates high-fidelity UI designs from a single text prompt.
tools.about: Galileo AI is a powerful tool that aims to accelerate the design process by generating editable, high-fidelity UI designs directly from text descriptions. It's trained on thousands of top-tier designs to produce visually consistent and appealing results.
pros: Incredibly fast way to generate initial design mockups.
Produces editable designs for tools like Figma.
UI is clean and easy to use.
cons: Still in early access, so there may be a waitlist.
Best for ideation, may require significant refinement for production.

tools.name: Uizard
tools.description: An AI-powered tool for rapidly creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.
tools.about: Uizard uses AI to speed up the design process. It can transform hand-drawn sketches into digital wireframes, generate UI designs from text prompts, and create entire design systems, making it a powerful tool for rapid prototyping.
pros: Can convert hand-drawn sketches into digital designs.
Generates multi-screen mockups from text prompts.
cons: The generated designs can be generic and may lack creativity.
Best for early-stage ideation rather than pixel-perfect final designs.

tools.name: Khroma
tools.description: An AI color tool that learns your preferences to generate limitless palettes.
tools.about: Khroma is an AI color palette generator. You start by choosing a set of 50 colors you like, and it uses that data to train a neural network that can generate thousands of color combinations tailored to your personal style.
pros: Creates personalized color palettes based on your taste.
Generates an infinite number of combinations.
cons: The initial training process can be time-consuming.
The interface can be overwhelming with so many options.
The AI's understanding of 'good' color combinations is subjective.

tools.name: Vev
tools.description: A visual editor for building websites that integrates AI for content and design.
tools.about: Vev is a no-code/low-code platform for creating professional websites. It incorporates AI to assist with writing copy, generating images, and even suggesting design layouts, aiming to streamline the entire web creation process.
pros: Combines a powerful visual editor with helpful AI assistants.
Great for creating interactive and animated web content.
Allows for collaboration between designers and developers.
cons: Can have a steeper learning curve than simpler website builders.
The best features are part of the paid plans.
The AI is an assistant, not a replacement for design skills.

tools.name: Framer AI
tools.description: AI features within the Framer website builder for generating and editing content.
tools.about: Framer is a popular tool for designing and building websites. Its AI features can generate entire landing pages from a text prompt, rewrite copy to fit a specific tone, and translate your site into different languages, all within the editor.
pros: Can generate a full, responsive website from a single prompt.
Seamlessly integrated into a powerful design tool.
The free plan is very generous.
cons: Generated sites are a starting point and require significant refinement.
The AI works best for standard marketing page layouts.
Can be more complex than necessary for very simple sites.

tools.about: Turn a prompt into themed presentations and marketing assets.

tools.about: Helps craft polished decks quickly using smart templates and design constraints.

tools.about: Generate and edit 3D scenes and assets with AI prompts in a web editor.

name: Research
description: Tools for analyzing research papers, extracting data, and synthesizing information.

tools.name: Elicit
tools.description: An AI research assistant that helps find papers and extract key information.
tools.about: Elicit uses language models to help automate research workflows. You can ask a research question, and it will find relevant papers, summarize their findings, and extract key information into a structured table.
pros: Can find papers without perfect keyword matches.
cons: Summaries may miss nuance from the full text.
Still requires critical evaluation of the source papers.

tools.name: Consensus
tools.description: An AI-powered search engine for finding evidence-based answers in research.
tools.about: Consensus is a search engine that uses AI to find and synthesize findings directly from scientific research. It's designed to provide evidence-based answers to questions by showing you what the published literature says.
pros: Provides direct access to findings from scientific papers.
Uses a 'Consensus Meter' to show the weight of evidence.
cons: Limited to topics covered in published research.
Requires careful interpretation of scientific language.

tools.name: Scholarcy
tools.description: Summarize research papers with highlights and flashcards.
tools.about: Extracts key points, figures, and references to accelerate reviews.

tools.name: Scite
tools.description: Smart citations showing how a paper is supported or contrasted.
tools.about: See supporting, contrasting, and mentioning citations to judge evidence.

tools.name: Litmaps
tools.description: Visual literature maps to discover related research.
tools.about: Map citations and topics to explore adjacent and seminal works quickly.

tools.name: Jasper (formerly Jarvis)
tools.description: A popular AI writing assistant for marketing copy, blog posts, and more.
tools.about: Jasper is one of the most well-known AI content platforms, designed to help marketing teams create high-quality copy for ads, emails, websites, and social media. It offers a wide range of templates for specific marketing tasks.
pros: Offers many templates for different formats.
Includes features for brand voice and SEO.
cons: Can be one of the more expensive options.
Requires some guidance and editing to get the best results.
Focus is heavily on marketing, less on general writing.

tools.name: Copy.ai
tools.description: An AI writing tool with a large suite of templates for marketing and sales copy.
tools.about: Copy.ai is an AI-powered writing tool that helps generate a wide range of marketing copy and other content. It provides over 90 templates and tools for tasks like writing blog posts, social media updates, ad copy, and sales emails. It is known for its user-friendly interface and features that can automate marketing workflows and maintain a consistent brand voice.
pros: Extensive library of templates for specific marketing tasks.
Real-time web search capability allows for more current content generation.
Generous free plan and cost-effective for teams.
cons: Long-form content editor is less robust than some competitors.
Generated content always requires fact-checking for accuracy.
Lacks built-in SEO optimization tools and a plagiarism checker.

tools.name: Surfer SEO
tools.description: An AI-powered tool for optimizing content to rank higher on search engines.
tools.about: Surfer SEO analyzes the top-ranking pages for a given keyword and provides a data-driven blueprint for how to write and structure your content to rank. It gives recommendations on keywords, structure, word count, and more.
pros: Helps optimize content before it's published.
Integrates with other writing tools like Jasper and Google Docs.
cons: Subscription can be expensive for individuals.
Recommendations should be treated as guidelines, not strict rules.

name: Data Analysis
description: Tools that use AI to help clean, analyze, and visualize data.

tools.name: Julius AI
tools.description: Analyze data in spreadsheets and CSV files by asking questions in plain English.
tools.about: Julius AI allows you to connect data sources like spreadsheets, CSVs, and databases, and then ask complex questions in natural language. It can perform analysis, create visualizations, and explain its methodology.
pros: Makes data analysis accessible to non-technical users.
Can create charts and graphs automatically.
Shows the Python code it generates for transparency.
cons: Free tier has limits on the number of queries.
May struggle with very complex or poorly structured data.
Requires a paid plan for advanced data sources.

tools.name: Tableau AI
tools.description: A suite of AI features integrated into the Tableau data visualization platform.
tools.about: Tableau AI (formerly Einstein Discovery) integrates AI and machine learning into the Tableau ecosystem. It can automatically find patterns in data, provide explanations for outcomes, and generate predictive models without requiring users to write code.
pros: Deeply integrated into a leading business intelligence platform.
Powerful for uncovering hidden insights in large datasets.
Can build and deploy predictive models.
cons: Part of an expensive enterprise software suite.
Requires well-structured data to be effective.
Can have a steep learning curve for advanced features.

tools.name: Power BI Copilot
tools.description: Natural‑language insights and narratives in Power BI.
tools.about: Ask questions of your data and generate summaries, DAX, and visuals in Power BI.

tools.name: Hex Magic
tools.description: Notebook and app platform with AI assistance for data teams.
tools.about: Blend SQL, Python, and charts; ship data apps with AI‑assisted analysis and docs.

tools.name: PandasAI
tools.description: Natural language to pandas code for dataframe analysis.
tools.about: Ask questions and generate pandas code to explore and visualize local data.

name: 3D Modeling
description: Generate 3D assets and textures using AI.

tools.name: Luma AI
tools.description: Create photorealistic 3D models from video clips using your phone.
tools.about: Luma AI uses a technique called NeRFs (Neural Radiance Fields) to create high-quality 3D models from videos. Users can capture a video of an object or scene, and Luma's AI processes it into a detailed, interactive 3D asset.
pros: Accessible through a user-friendly mobile app.
Free tier is sufficient for many hobbyist projects.
cons: Requires good lighting and careful video capture for best results.
Processing can take a significant amount of time.
Exporting in standard 3D formats may require a paid plan.

tools.name: Masterpiece Studio
tools.description: A suite of AI tools for generating and editing 3D models from text or images.
tools.about: Masterpiece Studio provides a generative AI platform that can create 3D models, textures, and animations from various inputs like text, images, or video. It's designed to accelerate the workflow for game developers, artists, and animators.
pros: Can generate 3D models from multiple types of input.
Aims to be a complete solution for 3D creation.
Offers a free tier to test the platform.
cons: Generated 3D models often require manual cleanup and optimization.
The technology is still rapidly evolving.
Can be complex to master all the available tools.

tools.name: Meshy
tools.description: Text/image‑to‑3D assets and textures for games and design.
tools.about: Generate meshes and materials from prompts, with web preview and export.

tools.name: Kaedim
tools.description: Turn 2D concepts into usable 3D game assets.
tools.about: Accelerates concept‑to‑asset workflows with human QA options.

tools.name: Blockade Labs Skybox
tools.description: Generate 360° skyboxes and environments from prompts.
tools.about: Create panoramic HDRIs/backgrounds for 3D scenes quickly.

tools.about: DreamFusion: Text-to-3D using 2D Diffusion

name: Ethical AI
description: Tools and platforms for ensuring fairness, transparency, and accountability in AI.

tools.name: Hugging Face Ethics & Society
tools.description: Resources and tools from Hugging Face for responsible AI development.
tools.about: Hugging Face, a central hub for the AI community, has a dedicated Ethics & Society team that provides tools, research, and guidelines for building more responsible AI. This includes tools for model bias detection and content moderation.
pros: Backed by a large and active open-source community.
cons: More of a resource hub than a single, installable tool.
Ethical considerations are complex and context-dependent.

tools.name: Fiddler AI
tools.description: A platform for monitoring, explaining, and analyzing AI models in production.
tools.about: Fiddler is an enterprise-grade Model Performance Management (MPM) platform. It helps organizations gain visibility into their production AI systems, explaining why models make certain predictions, detecting bias, and monitoring for performance drift.
pros: Provides crucial explainability for 'black box' models.
cons: Aimed at large enterprises with models in production.
Can be complex and expensive to implement.
Focuses on post-deployment, not the initial model training.

tools.name: IBM AI Fairness 360
tools.description: Open toolkit for detecting and mitigating bias in ML.
tools.about: Metrics and algorithms to assess fairness and reduce bias across the ML lifecycle.
cons: Limited UI out of the box.

tools.name: Microsoft Responsible AI Toolbox
tools.description: Interpretability, fairness, and causal analysis tools for ML.
tools.about: Suite of OSS tools (Error Analysis, InterpretML, Fairlearn integrations) for responsible AI.

tools.name: Fairlearn
tools.description: Fairness metrics and mitigation for Python ML.
tools.about: Assess and improve model fairness with metrics, visualizations, and reducers.

tools.name: fairlearn-dashboard
tools.description: Dashboard for evaluating the fairness of models.
tools.about: Dashboard for evaluating the fairness of models.

tools.name: @responsible-ai/fairness
tools.description: ![MIT license](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-blue.svg)
tools.about: ![MIT license](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-blue.svg)

tools.name: starvation-free-priority-queue
tools.description: An in-memory priority queue that prevents starvation by balancing priority and arrival time. Items are greedily prioritized within each batch of the longest-waiting items, ensuring fairness alongside prioritization and bounded delays for low-priority task
tools.about: An in-memory priority queue that prevents starvation by balancing priority and arrival time. Items are greedily prioritized within each batch of the longest-waiting items, ensuring fairness alongside prioritization and bounded delays for low-priority task

tools.about: An algorithm to transliterate Malayalam script to Roman / Latin characters (commonly 'Manglish') with reasonable phonetic fairness

name: Education
description: AI-powered tools for learning, teaching, and academic support.

tools.name: Khanmigo (Khan Academy)
tools.description: An AI-powered tutor and teaching assistant from Khan Academy.
tools.about: Khanmigo is an AI tutor integrated into the Khan Academy platform. It's designed to guide students through problems without giving away the answer, acting as a Socratic learning partner. It can also assist teachers with lesson planning.
pros: From a trusted, non-profit educational organization.
Can act as both a student tutor and a teacher's assistant.
cons: Requires a monthly donation/subscription to access.
Limited to the subjects and content available on Khan Academy.
Still in development and being actively improved.

tools.name: Quizlet Q-Chat
tools.description: An AI tutor that turns study materials into conversational practice.
tools.about: Q-Chat is a feature within Quizlet that uses AI to create an interactive tutoring experience from any study set. It can quiz you, help you understand concepts more deeply, and even teach you in a conversational way.
pros: Works with Quizlet's massive library of user-generated study sets.
Makes studying more engaging and interactive.
Free tier provides a good amount of access.
cons: Effectiveness depends on the quality of the underlying Quizlet set.
Most advanced features require a Quizlet Plus subscription.
Less structured than a full curriculum like Khanmigo.

tools.name: Duolingo Max
tools.description: Premium AI tutor features in Duolingo (explain my answer, roleplay).
tools.about: Enhanced language learning with conversational practice and granular feedback.

tools.name: MagicSchool AI
tools.description: Teacher tools for lesson plans, rubrics, and feedback.
tools.about: Save prep time with structured outputs aligned to classroom needs.

tools.name: Photomath
tools.description: Step‑by‑step math solutions via camera input.
tools.about: Scan problems and learn steps with explanations and alternate methods.

tools.name: One AI Tutor Per Child: Personalized learning is finally here
tools.description: One AI Tutor Per Child: Personalized learning is finally here

name: Crypto
description: AI-powered tools for crypto trading, market analysis, and blockchain intelligence.

tools.name: Arkham Intelligence
tools.description: An AI-powered blockchain intelligence platform that de-anonymizes transactions.
tools.about: Arkham Intelligence uses an AI engine called 'ULTRA' to algorithmically link blockchain addresses to real-world identities, providing transparency into the activities of whales, funds, and other major players in the crypto ecosystem.
pros: Powerful for tracking and analyzing crypto fund flows.
Provides a clear visualizer for mapping connections.
Features an 'Intel-to-Earn' marketplace for blockchain data bounties.
cons: Raises significant privacy concerns due to its focus on de-anonymization.
The sheer amount of data can be overwhelming for beginners.
Core user base is more for professional analysts and researchers.

tools.name: TokenMetrics
tools.description: AI-driven crypto analytics and investment research platform.
tools.about: TokenMetrics is an investment research platform that uses machine learning to analyze on-chain data, social sentiment, and developer activity. It provides quantitative ratings and price predictions for thousands of crypto assets to help investors make data-driven decisions.
pros: Provides actionable data-driven grades and insights.
Helps filter the noise in a volatile market.
Offers model portfolios and detailed asset analysis.
cons: Requires a paid subscription for most valuable features.
AI predictions are not financial advice and carry inherent risk.
The amount of information can be overwhelming for new investors.

tools.name: 3Commas
tools.description: A leading crypto trading bot platform for automating investment strategies.
tools.about: 3Commas allows users to create and deploy automated trading bots (like DCA bots, Grid bots, and Options bots) on over a dozen major crypto exchanges. It uses algorithms and user-defined strategies to execute trades 24/7, removing emotion from the trading process.
pros: Automates complex trading strategies around the clock.
Reduces the potential for emotional, panic-driven trading decisions.
Offers a marketplace for third-party signals and bot strategies.
cons: Requires a good understanding of trading strategies to be profitable.
Carries the inherent market risks of automated trading.
The free tier is very limited, requiring a subscription for serious use.

tools.name: Santiment
tools.description: A market intelligence platform providing on-chain, social, and development data.
tools.about: Santiment uses AI and machine learning to analyze vast amounts of data, including social media chatter, developer activity on GitHub, and on-chain transactions. Its goal is to identify market trends and crowd sentiment before they become mainstream, providing an edge to traders and investors.
pros: Provides unique metrics like social volume and developer activity.
Excellent for gauging the sentiment and hype around different assets.
Offers powerful, customizable alerts for key metrics.
cons: Raw data can be difficult to interpret without context.
The most valuable insights and real-time data require a paid subscription.
Less focused on direct trading signals and more on broad market behavior.

tools.name: IntoTheBlock
tools.description: ML‑driven on‑chain and market indicators for crypto assets.
tools.about: Explore holders, on‑chain flows, derivatives metrics, and signals.

tools.name: Nansen
tools.description: Wallet labels and smart money tracking across chains.
tools.about: Identify entity wallets, follow flows, and analyze behavior trends.

tools.name: Messari
tools.description: Crypto research, data, and screeners for investors.
tools.about: Curated research library with data tools for due diligence and monitoring.

tools.name: Show HN: StealthDrop – Anonymous crypto airdrops using zero-knowledge proofs
tools.description: Show HN: StealthDrop – Anonymous crypto airdrops using zero-knowledge proofs
tools.about: Show HN: StealthDrop – Anonymous crypto airdrops using zero-knowledge proofs

description: Tools and libraries to craft, refine, and manage high-quality prompts for LLMs and image models.

tools.name: AIPRM
tools.description: A library of curated prompt templates for ChatGPT and other LLMs.
tools.about: AIPRM provides a large, community-driven catalog of high-quality prompt templates organized by use case (SEO, marketing, coding, and more).

tools.name: Prompt Perfect

tools.about: Prompt Perfect helps users iteratively rephrase and enrich prompts to improve LLM response quality and reliability.
